oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PHOTOCHEMICAL REACTIVITIES OF PHENYL SELENO AND TELLURO ESTERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, AK
ROY, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Direct excitation (300 nm) of phenyl seleno and phenyl telluro benzoate in n-hexane, methanol, and silica gel matrices results in the formation of products because of dimerization of PhSe*/PhTe* radicals, and 1,3-migration of the PhTe* radical. Reactivity of the photogenerated radicals formed as a result of cleavage of the -CO-X-bond is markedly influenced by the diffusion characteristics of the radicals and the nature of group X.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF PHOTOCHEMISTRY AND PHOTOBIOLOGY A-CHEMISTRY, 69(1), 49-52
